title.native: デッドデッドデーモンズデデデデデストラクション　前章

description:
The first film of the Dead Dead Demon's Dededededestruction duology.

The Japan Self-Defense Forces are still looking for a way to combat the alien threat, but so far conventional weapons have had no effect. Maybe it’s time to try something unconventional.

Meanwhile, Kadode Koyama and her best friend avidly track the aliens’ movements on social media and less enthusiastically study for college entrance exams. When the end of the world looms overhead, you learn to take things one step at a time.

(Source: Viz Media)

tags.name: Seinen
tags.description: Target demographic is adult males.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Dystopian
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a society characterized by poverty, squalor or oppression.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Aliens
tags.description: Prominently features extraterrestrial lifeforms.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Denpa
tags.description: Works that feature themes of social dissociation, delusions, and other issues like suicide, bullying, self-isolation, paranoia, and technological necessity in daily lives. Classic iconography: telephone poles, rooftops, and trains.

tags.name: Post-Apocalyptic
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a world or civilization after a global disaster.

tags.name: Language Barrier
tags.description: A barrier to communication between people who are unable to speak a common language.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Demons
tags.description: Prominently features malevolent otherworldly creatures.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/asano_inio) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/asano_inio/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCUISMkOhQ2Em1uhXO7uIN8g)

A Japanese manga author. Asano created [Oyasumi Punpun](https://anilist.co/manga/34632/Goodnight-Punpun/), [Umibe no Onnanoko](https://anilist.co/manga/47353/A-Girl-on-the-Shore/), [Yuushatachi](https://anilist.co/manga/86217/Yuushatachi/) and the acclaimed manga [Solanin](https://anilist.co/manga/33731), which was released as a feature film in Japan in April 2010, starring [Aoi Miyazaki](https://anilist.co/staff/96055/Aoi-Miyazaki). Known for creating character-driven, realist stories, ranging from slice of life to psychological horror, Asano won first prize in the 2001 GX competition for young manga artists. In 2010, The Yomiuri Shimbun described Asano as "one of the voices of his generation."

He was previously married to the mangaka [Akane Torikai](https://anilist.co/staff/124465/Akane-Torikai).

__Notable work outside Manga:__

- No More Heroes III (Video Game, 2021) (NT Kamui Character Design)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/asano_inio) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/asano_inio/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCUISMkOhQ2Em1uhXO7uIN8g)

A Japanese manga author. Asano created [Oyasumi Punpun](https://anilist.co/manga/34632/Goodnight-Punpun/), [Umibe no Onnanoko](https://anilist.co/manga/47353/A-Girl-on-the-Shore/), [Yuushatachi](https://anilist.co/manga/86217/Yuushatachi/) and the acclaimed manga [Solanin](https://anilist.co/manga/33731), which was released as a feature film in Japan in April 2010, starring [Aoi Miyazaki](https://anilist.co/staff/96055/Aoi-Miyazaki). Known for creating character-driven, realist stories, ranging from slice of life to psychological horror, Asano won first prize in the 2001 GX competition for young manga artists. In 2010, The Yomiuri Shimbun described Asano as "one of the voices of his generation."

He was previously married to the mangaka [Akane Torikai](https://anilist.co/staff/124465/Akane-Torikai).

__Notable work outside Manga:__

- No More Heroes III (Video Game, 2021) (NT Kamui Character Design)

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/dajinman)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/tomoyuki.kurokawa.7)__

__Tomoyuki Kurokawa__ is a Japanese director, episode director and storyboard artist. He was affiliated with studio Bee Train.

He made his lead directorial debut with the OVA _[Murder Princess](https://anilist.co/anime/1696/Murder-Princess/)_, and had his first lead director role with the release of _[Psychic Detective Yakumo](https://anilist.co/anime/7662/Shinrei-Tantei-Yakumo/)_.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E4%BC%8A%E6%9D%B1%E4%BC%B8%E9%AB%98)

Best known for his individual designs outside of the industry's norm.

Originating from Studio Dove. Itou started as an in-betweener on [Zettai Muteki Raijin Ou](https://anilist.co/anime/1897/) and made his debut as a character designer on the series [Kemonozume](https://anilist.co/anime/1454/), directed by [Masaaki Yuasa](https://anilist.co/staff/100068/). He has since designed the characters for most of Yuasa's works.
[Twitter](https://mobile.twitter.com/MIKA_NISHIMURA)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/吉田玲子) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reiko_Yoshida)

Yoshida has written and supervised numerous scripts for anime series, live-action dramas and films. Her major works include [Kaleido Star](https://anilist.co/anime/427), [Aria](https://anilist.co/anime/477), [Maria-sama ga Miteru](https://anilist.co/anime/158), [D.Gray-man](https://anilist.co/anime/1482), [K-On!](https://anilist.co/anime/5680), [Bakuman](https://anilist.co/anime/7674) and [Girls und Panzer](https://anilist.co/anime/14131). In more recent works, she has supervised the screenplays for [Majestic Prince](https://anilist.co/anime/15863), [Non Non Biyori](https://anilist.co/anime/17549), [A Town Where You Live](https://anilist.co/anime/17741), [Tamako Market](https://anilist.co/anime/16417), [Yowamushi Pedal](https://anilist.co/anime/18179) and [Castle Town Dandelion](https://anilist.co/anime/20951). In films, she wrote the screenplay for Ghibli's [The Cat Returns](https://anilist.co/anime/597), the original films that would make up [Digimon: The Movie](https://anilist.co/anime/2961), Kyoto Animation’s hit anime film [A Silent Voice](https://anilist.co/anime/20954), and the film adaptations of Osamu Tezuka's [Buddha](https://anilist.co/anime/7014), the last one's [second film](https://anilist.co/anime/20500) was given a stamp of approval by the Dalai Lama.

Among her works, she was recognized for Best Screenplay/Original Work for [Girls und Panzer](https://anilist.co/anime/14131) at the Tokyo Anime Award Festival in 2014, and she won another Best Screenplay/Original Work award in 2017. In 2018, she wrote the screenplay for [Violet Evergarden](https://anilist.co/anime/21827) which aired on TV in Japan and is licensed by Netflix.

Yoshida also wrote the story for the manga series [Tokyo Mew Mew](https://anilist.co/manga/30554).

(Source: Wikipedia)

Started playing piano in elementary school. After graduating high school, he entered an era of being influenced by new wave, Serge Gainsbourg, Jon Brion and so on. He finally learned composition and orchestration in Tokyo University of the Arts Music Department, During his days in University, he signed to Rallye Label in August 2012 under the name milk.

([Source](http://piano.tt/umebayashi))

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/吉田玲子) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reiko_Yoshida)

Yoshida has written and supervised numerous scripts for anime series, live-action dramas and films. Her major works include [Kaleido Star](https://anilist.co/anime/427), [Aria](https://anilist.co/anime/477), [Maria-sama ga Miteru](https://anilist.co/anime/158), [D.Gray-man](https://anilist.co/anime/1482), [K-On!](https://anilist.co/anime/5680), [Bakuman](https://anilist.co/anime/7674) and [Girls und Panzer](https://anilist.co/anime/14131). In more recent works, she has supervised the screenplays for [Majestic Prince](https://anilist.co/anime/15863), [Non Non Biyori](https://anilist.co/anime/17549), [A Town Where You Live](https://anilist.co/anime/17741), [Tamako Market](https://anilist.co/anime/16417), [Yowamushi Pedal](https://anilist.co/anime/18179) and [Castle Town Dandelion](https://anilist.co/anime/20951). In films, she wrote the screenplay for Ghibli's [The Cat Returns](https://anilist.co/anime/597), the original films that would make up [Digimon: The Movie](https://anilist.co/anime/2961), Kyoto Animation’s hit anime film [A Silent Voice](https://anilist.co/anime/20954), and the film adaptations of Osamu Tezuka's [Buddha](https://anilist.co/anime/7014), the last one's [second film](https://anilist.co/anime/20500) was given a stamp of approval by the Dalai Lama.

Among her works, she was recognized for Best Screenplay/Original Work for [Girls und Panzer](https://anilist.co/anime/14131) at the Tokyo Anime Award Festival in 2014, and she won another Best Screenplay/Original Work award in 2017. In 2018, she wrote the screenplay for [Violet Evergarden](https://anilist.co/anime/21827) which aired on TV in Japan and is licensed by Netflix.

Yoshida also wrote the story for the manga series [Tokyo Mew Mew](https://anilist.co/manga/30554).

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E4%BC%8A%E6%9D%B1%E4%BC%B8%E9%AB%98)

Best known for his individual designs outside of the industry's norm.

Originating from Studio Dove. Itou started as an in-betweener on [Zettai Muteki Raijin Ou](https://anilist.co/anime/1897/) and made his debut as a character designer on the series [Kemonozume](https://anilist.co/anime/1454/), directed by [Masaaki Yuasa](https://anilist.co/staff/100068/). He has since designed the characters for most of Yuasa's works.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/takeshitakadera)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yamibun)

A freelance writer who specialises in military and historical research. He graduated from Hokkaido University's Department of Literature and Philosophy.

His most important work was the multimedia project Strike Witches, for which he provided military and world research aide as well as penned scripts for the anime series and wrote lyrics for several related songs. His other works include short novel stories for various magazines, like MC Axis, two currently serialised manga series with Tsuki no Umi no Rua (Young King Ours) and Sailor Fuku to Juusensha (Champion Red Ichigo) and several doujin works. He did also write scripts and was SF aide for the Gonzo anime series Last Exile, Witchblade, GunXSword and Solty Rei.

He is member of the doujin circle Firstspear.

(Source: Anidb)

[Website](https://lilasikuta.jp) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ikutalilas) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/lilasikuta/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCztEY6czNyJKjRWMwuur9bg) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/1qM11R4ylJyQiPJ0DffE9z)

Lilas Ikuta is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist and member of the music duo [YOASOBI](https://anilist.co/staff/194287/). She is also formerly a member of PLUSONICA and a 4th Generation member of the LESSON, a program made by Sony Music Japan that bases sending artists out into the world, and they draw out each student's potential and give them a thorough lesson on how to become an artist.

[Website](https://ano-official.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ano2mass) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/a_n_o2mass/) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@anovamos)

ano is a Japanese singer, model, actor, and TV personality. She was a member of the idol group You'll Melt More! (ゆるめるモ!) from 2013-2019. In 2020, she started solo activities under the name "ano". In 2021, she formed the band "I's" with Takuya Nakayama (from Goodbye Fujiyama), Ryuki Maeda (from ALL CITY STEPPERS) and Ryouta Unebasami (from SUNNY CAR WASH) where she performs guitar and vocals.

She played [Momoko Touyoko](https://anilist.co/character/23036) in the TV drama and live-action movie adaptations of the manga [Saki](https://anilist.co/manga/36310/Saki/).

__Birthplace:__ Saitama Prefecture, Japan

Tooru Kitajima, better known as TK, is a singer, songwriter and the lead vocalist and guitarist of the Japanese rock band [Ling Tosite Sigure](http://anilist.co/staff/115154/LingTositeSigure). In 2011, he started to release solo material as "TK from Ling tosite sigure", and started to collaborate with Masayuki Nakano from the former electronic music band [Boom Boom Satellites](https://anilist.co/staff/103901/Boom-Boom-Satellites).

__Birthplace:__ Saitama Prefecture, Japan

Tooru Kitajima, better known as TK, is a singer, songwriter and the lead vocalist and guitarist of the Japanese rock band [Ling Tosite Sigure](http://anilist.co/staff/115154/LingTositeSigure). In 2011, he started to release solo material as "TK from Ling tosite sigure", and started to collaborate with Masayuki Nakano from the former electronic music band [Boom Boom Satellites](https://anilist.co/staff/103901/Boom-Boom-Satellites).

__Residency:__ Tokyo, Japan

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Kuvshinov_Ilya) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/member.php?id=789222) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kuvshinov_ilya) | [ArtStation](https://www.artstation.com/kuvshinov_ilya) | [DeviantArt](https://www.deviantart.com/kuvshinov-ilya) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/KuvshinovIlia) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/Mad1Artist) | [Vimeo](https://vimeo.com/kuvshinovilya) | [Tumblr](http://kuvshinov-ilya.tumblr.com/)

Ilya Kuvshinov is a Russian born animator, illustrator and designer.
Affiliated with [Production +h](https://anilist.co/studio/6737/).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/taro_happyworld)
